channel.title: Webclient run error
channel.description: I'm trying to make a webclient and when I made the jar file and I tested it it didn't work I decided to run the .bat file and get the error and I got this: [code]java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.jvnet.substance.skin.SubstanceRavenGraphit eLookAndFeel at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:247) at javax.swing.SwingUtilities.loadSystemClass(SwingUtilities.java:1844) at javax.swing.UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.java:557) at Gui.initUI(Gui.java:68) at Gui.<init>(Gui.java:49) at Gui.main(Gui.java:38)[/code]anyone know what caused this or how to fix it?

item.title: Webclient run error
item.dc:creator: @j19283746 j19283746
item.description:
@j19283746 wrote:

OO Got it

item.title: Webclient run error
item.dc:creator: @coalman58 coalman58
item.description:
@coalman58 wrote:

[quote=“j19283746, post:6, topic:353841”]It cant find the path that you specified. In other words, you dont have a folder called that.[/quote]because it didnt extract it

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient run error
item.dc:creator: @j19283746 j19283746
item.description:
@j19283746 wrote:

It cant find the path that you specified. In other words, you dont have a folder called that.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient run error
item.dc:creator: @coalman58 coalman58
item.description:
@coalman58 wrote:

[quote=“itai, post:2, topic:353841”]It is saying that it cannot find the Skin gui wants it to. Maybe remove that from gui then compile then try again.

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.jvnet.substance.skin.SubstanceRavenGraphit eLookAndFeel [/quote]Thanks it worked. ok i probly should start a new post but i’ll try my luck on this one. the client runs and downloads the cache now but it wont extract it 100% it only does about 70% of it. in the cmd i got these errors:

java.lang.NullPointerException at Gui.midiPlayer(Gui.java:399) at Gui.initUI(Gui.java:331) at Gui.<init>(Gui.java:49) at Gui.main(Gui.java:38) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\.csx_file_store_32\anim\1000.dat (The system c annot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:179) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:70) at client.unZipFile(client.java:4394) at client.downloadcache(client.java:4358) at client.method67(client.java:4432) at client.method6(client.java:8500) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:52) at client.run(client.java:288) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) Error: loaderror Unpacking was complete 10

Read full topic

item.description:
@itai wrote:

Mod Val:

Gui usually holds the ip, if not then try removing it.

He only has to remove a line of code in gui.

item.title: Webclient run error
item.dc:creator: @coalman58 coalman58
item.description:
@coalman58 wrote:

I’m trying to make a webclient and when I made the jar file and I tested it it didn’t work I decided to run the .bat file and get the error and I got this:

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.jvnet.substance.skin.SubstanceRavenGraphit eLookAndFeel at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:247) at javax.swing.SwingUtilities.loadSystemClass(SwingUtilities.java:1844) at javax.swing.UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.java:557) at Gui.initUI(Gui.java:68) at Gui.<init>(Gui.java:49) at Gui.main(Gui.java:38)anyone know what caused this or how to fix it?
